intro: Sphaerostephanos toppingii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with compact foliage and vibrant blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to produce multiple flower spikes throughout the growing season.
